abstract: The Canadian aluminum producer Alcan rejected a $27.4 billion hostile bid from a rival, Alcoa, on Tuesday, calling the offer inadequate. Alcan said that it was in talks with other companies — The Globe and Mail newspaper reported that one of them is the Australian mining giant BHP Billiton — and added that it was considering the possibility of turning the tables with a counterbid for Alcoa.
